attributes.action: Raising the Quality of Prime Ministers Questions
attributes.additional_details:
The questions posed to the Prime Minister during the regular Prime Minister’s Questions sessions and the answers given should be posted on the internet together with a voting mechanism for the public to rate the quality of the question and the answer on a 5 point scale ranging from very poor to very good. Comments could be given to back up the ratings.

A cumulative analysis of the scores achieved over various timescales should be published. The Prime Minister could comment on the ratings achieved.  Over time this will drive up the quality of the questions and answers.
